benchmark_details.name: BaitBuster -Bangla: A Comprehensive Dataset for Clickbait Detection in Bangla with Multi -Feature and Multi -Modal Analysis
benchmark_details.overview: This study presents a large multi-modal Bangla YouTube clickbait dataset consisting of 253,070 data points collected through an automated process using the YouTube API and Python web automation frameworks. The dataset contains 18 diverse features categorized into metadata, primary content, engagement statistics, and labels for individual videos from 58 Bangla YouTube channels.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive dataset for clickbait detection in Bangla, aiding research in low-resource languages and enabling multi-modal analyses of clickbait.

data.annotation: Initial labels were assigned based on predefined channel classifications, followed by manual annotation of a stratified sample of 10,000 data points.

methodology.calculation: Metrics were calculated based on the model performances on validation and test datasets.
methodology.interpretation: High accuracy and F1 scores indicate effective detection of clickbait.
methodology.validation: The dataset was validated through rigorous preprocessing, denoising, deduplication, and debiasing, alongside evaluations of model performances.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All data has been de-identified and anonymized to protect the privacy of users.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Informed consent was not required as the data collected is publicly available on YouTube.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: The data collection process complied with the terms of service of the YouTube platform.
